Class DoTheWork

  • java.lang.Object
    • DoTheWork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDoTheWork

    public class DoTheWork
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDoTheWork
    Application class for reading the EL155 and parsing into an 'LinkedList' of cast vote records, then counting the votes for President. This class is passed a file as an input 'Scanner' and reads that file into an 'ArrayList', each entry of which is a 'CastVote'. Because the precinct name and number come only from the header line, this 'String' is also passed in to the constructor and is parsed. Rules: parsing the header lines is done in this class. parsing the actual cast vote lines is done in 'CastVote'. Copyright (C) 2012 by Duncan A. Buell. All rights reserved.
    Version:
    1.00 2012-12-20
    Author:
    Duncan A. Buell used by Patrick Hamod

    • Method Detail

      • countTheVotes

        public java.lang.String countTheVotes(java.lang.String rawContest)
        Method to count the votes for a contest. Note that we use the term 'rawContest' to refer to a contest. This is so we don't need the precise name. The lookups are all done by matching presence of the raw contest string in the choice, not by matching that the contest in the choice equals the string.
        Specified by:
        countTheVotes in interface IDoTheWork
        Returns:
        the 'String' version of the counts for this contest.

      • findPatterns

        public java.lang.String findPatterns()
        Method to find patterns in the voting. At the moment all we look for, in a naive way, are the top five most frequent pairs and triples of voting occurrences.
        Specified by:
        findPatterns in interface IDoTheWork
        Returns:
        a 'String' version of the results suitable for printing

      • getPctInfo

        public java.lang.String getPctInfo(java.lang.String inputLine)
        Method to get the precinct from the input header line. This method knows that precinct info starts with the 'String' "PRECINCT" and ends before the 'String' "ELECTION".
        Specified by:
        getPctInfo in interface IDoTheWork
        Parameters:
        inputLine - the line to parse
        Returns:
        the precinct

      • isCastVote

        public boolean isCastVote(java.lang.String inputLine)
        Method to determine if the line is a cast vote line. The definition of being a cast vote line is that the zeroth char is a leading '5' in an iVotronic serial number.
        Specified by:
        isCastVote in interface IDoTheWork
        Parameters:
        inputLine - the line to parse
        Returns:
        the answer to the question

      • isHeader

        public boolean isHeader(java.lang.String inputLine)
        Method to determine if the line is a header line. The definition of being a header line is that the line begins with the 'String' "RUN DATE".
        Specified by:
        isHeader in interface IDoTheWork
        Parameters:
        inputLine - the line to parse
        Returns:
        the answer to the question

      • isNewVote

        public boolean isNewVote(java.lang.String inputLine)
        Method to determine if the line is a new vote. The definition of being a cast vote line is that there is an asterisk in the line.
        Specified by:
        isNewVote in interface IDoTheWork
        Parameters:
        inputLine - the line to parse
        Returns:
        the answer to the question

      • readFile

        public void readFile(java.util.Scanner inFile)
        Method to read the cast vote records into the 'ArrayList'. We read line by line. If it's a header, we pull off the pct info. If not a header but is a cast vote line, we create a new 'CastVote' with the pct data and the line and add the 'CastVote' to the 'ArrayList'.
        Specified by:
        readFile in interface IDoTheWork
        Parameters:
        inFile - the Scanner from which to read.
